meanings.definition: Excessive concentration on a single object or idea.
meanings.sent1: Her monomania for collecting stamps consumed all her free time.
meanings.sent2: His monomania for cleanliness made him scrub the floors every day.
meanings.sent3: Bob's monomania for organizing his sock drawer reached new heights when he color-coded them.
meanings.sent4: Sarah's monomania for perfection turned her into a relentless perfectionist.
meanings.sent5: The artist's monomania for detail was evident in every brushstroke of the painting.

meanings.definition: A pathological obsession with one idea or subject.
meanings.sent1: His monomania about conspiracy theories led him to believe in outlandish plots.
meanings.sent2: The patient's monomania about germs caused her to wash her hands repeatedly.
meanings.sent3: Tom's monomania about aliens made him convinced that his cat was an extraterrestrial in disguise.
meanings.sent4: The CEO's monomania about efficiency turned the company into a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The detective's monomania about solving the case kept him up at night, analyzing every clue.
